articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian President
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, president of Mongolia, on September 8.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend sincere congratulations to you and, through you, to the friendly Korean people on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 I am satisfied with the fact that the traditional, friendly and cooperative relations between our two countries develop successfully.
					
					 I am pleased to develop these relations in not only the field of politics but also the field of economy and cooperate with respected Your Excellency in the direction of promoting the regional and international peace and security in the future, too.
					
					 I am convinced that this meets the interests of not only the two peoples but also the cause for regional stability.
					
					 The message wished Kim Jong Un good health and the Korean people great successes in their cause for building the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Indonesian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Indonesian President
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, president of the Republic of Indonesia, on September 5.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend best wishes and warm congratulations to you and the people of the DPRK on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 I am satisfied with the excellent relations maintained by our two countries in the past period.
					
					 I express my firm belief that the friendly relations between Indonesia and the DPRK would grow stronger in the future.
					
					 Paying the highest tribute to Your Excellency, I most sincerely wish Your Excellency happiness and the people of the DPRK progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Thai King
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Thai King
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Bhumibol Adulyadej, king of Thailand, on Sept. 4.
					 The message said:
					
					 Extending warm congratulations to Your Excellency on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK, I sincerely wish Your Excellency good health and happiness and the DPRK and the Korean people progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of Qatar
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of Qatar
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Tamim Bin Hamad Al-Thani, emir of the State of Qatar, on Sept. 9.
					 The message said:
					
					 I am pleased to extend sincere congratulations to Your Excellency on behalf of the people of the State of Qatar and on my own behalf on your national day.
					
					 I most sincerely wish Your Excellency good health and the people of your country steady progress and development.
					
					 Please accept my highest regards.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of DR Congo
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of DR Congo
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of DR Congo, on Sept. 1.
					 The message said that he extends warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on his own behalf and on behalf of all the people of DR Congo.
					
					 It expressed the will to strengthen the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of Algeria, on Sept. 5.
					 The message said that he was pleased to extend the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the Algerian people and government and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and the friendly people greater progress and wellbeing. 
					
					 The message reiterated the will to join Kim Jong Un in the efforts to boost the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries in conformity with the interests and aspiration of their peoples.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Ugandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Ugandan President
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of Uganda, on Sept. 5.
					 The message said that he extends the warmest congratulations and sincerest greetings to Kim Jong Un, the government and people of the DPRK on his own behalf and on behalf of the Ugandan government and people on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK, September 9, 2014.
					
					 The message hoped that the good bilateral relations with Kim Jong Un, the government and people of the DPRK would steadily develop on good terms. 
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and the Korean people eternal prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Greece
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Greece
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Carlos Papoulias, president of Greece, on Sept. 9.
					 The message said that he extends congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the people of Greece and on his own behalf on the occasion of the birthday of the DPRK and sincerely wished the people of the DPRK happiness and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Guinean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Guinean President
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Alpha Conde, president of Guinea, on Sept. 8.
					 The message said that he extends the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the Guinean government and people and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 He reaffirmed the firm determination to make all his efforts to comprehensively strengthen the historic relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Guinea.
					
					 He sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and the Korean people happiness and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Egyptian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Egyptian President
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, president of the Arab Republic of Egypt, on Sept. 8.
					 The message said:
					
					 I am very pleased to extend warm congratulations to Your Excellency on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 I sincerely wish Your Excellency good health and happiness and the friendly people of your country big progress and prosperity.
					
					 Please accept my highest regards.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Nepalese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Nepalese President
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Ram Baran Yadav, president of Nepal, on September 9.
					 The message said:
					
					 Extending warm congratulations to Your Excellency on the happy opportunity for celebrating the national day of the DPRK, I sincerely wish Your Excellency good health and happiness and the Korean people progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Mexican President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Mexican President
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Enrique Pena Nieto, president of the United Mexican States, on Sept. 9.
					 The message said:
					
					 I, on behalf of the Mexican people, congratulate Your Excellency on the founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I reaffirm my government's stand to make joint efforts to boost the relations between our two countries.
					
					 Please accept my sincere regards and high tribute.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Kenyan President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Kenyan President
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Uhuru Kenyatta, president of the Republic of Kenya, on September 2.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm greetings to you and the people of the DPRK on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK, September 9, 2014.
					
					 I am sure that the relations between Kenya and the DPRK will develop in the common interests of the peoples of our two countries.
					
					 I wish Your Excellency good health and the Korean people steady successes in their efforts for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Acting President of Zimbabwe
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Acting President of Zimbabwe
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Joyce Teurai Ropa Mujuru, acting president of Zimbabwe, on August 28.
					 The message said that he extends congratulations to Kim Jong Un, and, through him, to the DPRK government and people on behalf of the Zimbabwean government and people and on his own behalf.
					
					 The message noted that Zimbabwe values the good relations with the DPRK.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and the people of the DPRK peace and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Russian Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Russian Political Party Leader
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from S. M. Mironov, chairman of the A Just Russia, on Sept. 2.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend congratulations to you and all the Korean people on behalf of the A Just Russia and on my own behalf on the occasion of the 66th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					
					 It was an important event in the modern world history that Comrade Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK in 1948.
					
					 This event brought about the beginning of the building of a new socialist state on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 I wish you good health and happiness and all the citizens of the DPRK great successes.
					
					 I hope the cooperation between our two countries and between the A Just Russia and the Workers' Party of Korea would successfully develop.
					
					 Please accept my high regards.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Mexican Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Mexican Political Party Leader
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of greeting from Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, national leader of the Workers' Party of Mexico, on September 2.
					 The message said:
					
					 I am honored to extend warmest congratulations and fraternal greetings to you on behalf of all the members of the Workers' Party of Mexico and on my own behalf on the occasion of September 9, the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 We recognize that the DPRK founded and led by great Comrade Kim Il Sung and great Comrade Kim Jong Il is the Juche-based socialist state with the single-minded unity and invincible military capability and the genuine people's power which has dynamically struggled for the prosperity, wellbeing and happiness of the Korean people.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I sincerely wish you good health for the prosperity of the DPRK and the final victory of the world socialist cause, expressing belief that the nation-building exploits performed by great Comrade Kim Il Sung and great Comrade Kim Jong Il will further shine in the course of building a thriving socialist nation under your wise Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Please accept my highest regards.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian and Russian Figures
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian and Russian Figures
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received gifts from Nigerian and Russian figures on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					 They were handed to the DPRK ambassadors to their countries by a member of the Senate of Nigeria and S.A. Abazov, general manager of the Stroiotdelka Co. Ltd in Nizegorod Region of Russia, on Sept. 1 and 6.

articles.title: Russian Guests Leave
articles.content:
Russian Guests Leave
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Torshyn, first vice-chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, and his companion left here for home on Friday.

articles.title: British Delegation of Businessmen Leaves
articles.content:
British Delegation of Businessmen Leaves
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- The British delegation of businessmen led by Evgeny Lebedev left here for home on Friday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
Pongsan, September 12 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent a birthday spread to grandmother Kwon Nang Ho living in Kachon-ri, Pongsan County, North Hwanghae Province on her 100th birthday.
					 It was conveyed to her on Friday.
					
					 She was born as a daughter of a poor farmer a century ago and lived as tenant farmer, subject to all maltreatment and humiliation with the grief of statelessness. It wasn't until the liberation of the country by President Kim Il Sung that she could lead a worthy life.
					
					 She could experience the historic moment of the agrarian reform which solved the long-cherished desire of farmers along with the country's liberation and the event of agricultural cooperativization after the war.
					
					 She had worked as farmer for several decades.
					
					 Even after becoming a pensioner, she kept herself busy doing work.
					
					 Having balanced diet, she keeps herself optimistic, helps her children in their work and tends a vegetable garden.

articles.title: DPRK-Russia Stamp Show
articles.content:
DPRK-Russia Stamp Show
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- A DPRK-Russia stamp show is going on at the Korean Stamp Museum here.
					 On display at the show are a large number of stamps, presented by philatelists of the DPRK and Russia, which give a glimpse of the history, culture and present-day development of both countries.
					
					 Among the exhibits are stamps collected by Pu Yong Jin, a researcher of Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University, Sin Kum Chol, a creator of the Mansudae Art Studio, and Kim Hyon Nam, section chief of the Munsu Recovery Center, and An Jun Ok, an official of the Ministry of External Economic Relations.
					
					 What catch visitors' eyes in particular are the stamps picturing President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on visits to the Russian Federation.
					
					 And there are stamps featuring animals and plants, famous scientists of the DPRK and Russia and the 22nd Winter Olympics held in Sochi.
					
					 The stamps picturing the castle and towers of Kremlin and a Russian woman pilot have also come under attention of visitors.

articles.title: 14th Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival to Be Held
articles.content:
14th Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival to Be Held
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- The 14th Pyongyang International Film Festival is to be held here.
					 Over 100 films from 40 odd countries and international organizations will be screened during the festival from September 17 to 24.
					
					 There will be competitions of long feature,, documentary and short films, special screening which were highly appreciated in the recent international film festivals, circular screening of various kinds of films and film exchange meeting for collaboration and technological cooperation among various countries.
					
					 There will be also a preview of Korean films.

articles.title: New Kind of Health Product Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Kind of Health Product Developed in DPRK
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- A new kind of health product was developed by the Bioindustry Institute under Kim Il Sung University.
					 The product is bone-reinforced protein, made of protein from soymilk and calcium gluconate and fermented bean.
					
					 It helps improve health of the old and facilitate the growth of children with no side effect.
					
					 Kim Chol Jin, a researcher of the institute, told KCNA that it was proved that bone disease begins to get better one month after the product is taken regularly and that the demand for it is increasing among local people.

articles.title: Competent Educator in Sinuiju of DPRK
articles.content:
Competent Educator in Sinuiju of DPRK
Sinuiju, September 12 (KCNA) -- The Ponbu Kindergarten in Sinuiju City of the DPRK is well known to the country for having turned out a large number of prodigies talented in music, calligraphy and fine art.
					 Its development into a competent educational institution is associated with the devoted efforts of chief Kim Ok Son.
					
					 Kim graduated a university of education and has worked at the kindergarten for more than 30 years, starting her career as its head in Juche 72 (1983). She, once a choreographer, has devoted all her wisdom and zeal to training talented children.
					
					 Thank to her efforts, the Ponbu Kindergarten came first in the National Art Festival of Kindergarteners more than 20 times and 20-odd children of it won special and first prizes at the seven rounds of national talent competition of kindergarteners. Its children took part in the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", striking spectators with admiration.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il in his lifetime highly appreciated Kim Ok Son's devoted service for the children and sent a birthday spread to her.
					
					 She won the titles of Labor Hero and People's Teacher.

articles.title: U.S. Forces' Withdrawal from S. Korea Is Required by Trend of Times: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
U.S. Forces' Withdrawal from S. Korea Is Required by Trend of Times: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Koreans are becoming  increasingly  vocal demanding the withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea. 
					 This is because the U.S. troops' presence in south Korea is a main factor of disturbing peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia. 
					
					 The U.S. troops illegally occupied south Korea under the pretext of "disarming the Imperial Japanese army" after the Second World War. For nearly seven decades they have taken the lead in carrying out the U.S. strategy for confrontation and war on the peninsula and in other parts of Northeast Asia. 
					
					 The U.S. troops in south Korea are neither forces under the control of the United Nations nor peace-keeping forces dispatched to dispute-torn areas according to the UN resolution. 
					
					 The purpose of their presence and objective of their operations are to invade the DPRK and hold a military edge in Northeast Asia. 
					
					 What is the most grave in their activities are the joint military drills as they cause a vicious cycle of tensions on the Korean peninsula. 
					
					 The joint military drills staged with the U.S. forces in south Korea playing a major role are very dangerous saber-rattling which may bring catastrophic consequences to the Korean peninsula in the light of their nature, scale and frequency. 
					
					 They have staged at least 18 000 war drills and joint military maneuvers against the DPRK in south Korea and in its vicinity since the ceasefire, counting only those opened to media. 
					
					 The U.S. shifted the pivot of its strategy to the Asia-Pacific region from Europe in recent years. It is intensifying large-scale war drills with the south Korean puppet warmongers, directing the spearhead of attack to the DPRK. 
					
					 They are openly staging war drills for "occupying Pyongyang" with strategic nuclear bombers, aircraft carriers and nuclear submarines involved, while applying "tailored deterrence strategy" for preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. troops in south Korea are the root cause of disaster as they create constant instability of the situation not only on the Korean Peninsula but in  the rest of Northeast Asia. 
					
					 The international community is becoming evermore vocal demanding the withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea which are harmful to ensuring peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and in the region. 
					
					 The Strategic Studies Institute affiliated to U.S. Army College of War recently made public a report which underscored the necessity to reexamine the issue of the presence of the U.S. forces in south Korea as it is the old one based on the logic which has been preserved without any reassessment after the Cold War. 
					
					 The CSIS, AEI and RAND, etc. in the U.S. called strategy think tanks advanced this view. 
					
					 Not only south Korean public and international community but American public call for the pullback of the U.S. troops from south Korea because it reflects the demand of the times. 
					
					 It cannot but be something anachronistic that the presence of the U.S. troops in south Korea is going on even today when the international relations have undergone a dramatic change in Northeast Asia since the demise of the Cold War era. 
					
					 There is no justification for the U.S. to keep its aggressor forces in south Korea. 
					
					 The U.S. should withdraw its troops from south Korea as early as possible.

articles.title: Country Dignified Thanks to Independence Can Guarantee National Prosperity: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Country Dignified Thanks to Independence Can Guarantee National Prosperity: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- One can see his nation's genuine dignity and eternal prosperity in the country where independent politics is in force, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 The DPRK emerged a unique politico-ideological power with the unbreakable single-minded unity and a military power which no formidable enemy dares provoke. Such world-startling status of the DPRK would be unthinkable without the Songun politics, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Songun politics means the politics of loving the people as it most correctly and comprehensively reflects their will and the wishes and guarantees their independent right and dignity at the highest level.
					
					 It is thanks to the invincible Songun politics that no one can provoke Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses and it remains unfazed in face of any worldwide upheaval.
					
					 The Songun politics of the DPRK completely changed the geopolitical meaning of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Gone are the days never to return when big powers were free to perpetrate high-handed and arbitrary practices after having a monopoly of nukes and satellites. The DPRK has firmly seized the initiative for ensuring peace on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 The Songun politics has brought all Koreans hope and confidence in the country's reunification and the rosy future of the nation's prosperity.
					
					 One can never expect a rosy future of his nation on the land where its sovereignty is trampled down.
					
					 South Korea still remains a tundra-like colony where even the elementary sovereignty and the right to existence of people are not ensured as its politics, military, economy, culture and all other fields are controlled by the U.S.
					
					 As long as the Songun politics is in force, no aggressor forces dare browbeat the service personnel and people of the DPRK and it will always remain a strong fortress of independence.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Stage Actions in Demand of Probe into Truth behind Ferry Sewol Disaster
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Stage Actions in Demand of Probe into Truth behind Ferry Sewol Disaster
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the U.S. staged actions in demand of the probe into the truth behind the ferry Sewol disaster in Washington on Sept. 6, according to the south Korean internet paper Jaju Minbo.
					 They held a meeting in front of the office of the Washington Post at which they strongly denounced the south Korean authorities for sidestepping the ferry disaster and urging them to probe the truth at early as possible.
					
					 Then, they staged a demonstration outside the White House.
					
					 They continued to stage the demonstration in solidarity with the ranks of students denouncing the U.S. police for mercilessly killing a black boy.
					
					 The protestors held that though hundreds of students died, media did not properly report about it and the regime carelessly reacted to this happening. Passing the buck for this, the regime is cracking down on them, they deplored.

articles.title: People Killed by Tick Virus Infection in S. Korea
articles.content:
People Killed by Tick Virus Infection in S. Korea
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- People were reported killed by ticks in south Korea, according to south Korean MBC.
					 From January to the end of August this year, the number of the cases, who have been infected with the virus carried by ticks, has risen to over  20, and 10 out of the cases were reported dead.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Slams Authorities' Campaign to Eliminate "Followers of North"
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Slams Authorities' Campaign to Eliminate "Followers of North"
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People in an editorial on Thursday blasted the south Korean puppet authorities for slandering the south Korean people's anti-U.S., anti-regime struggle in linkage with the north. 
					 The authorities recently kicked off a campaign to eliminate "followers of the north" after the case of attempted rebellion by the Unified Progressive Party was given a verdict of not guilty, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 The assertions of the "government" have common strange points. They clarified commentaries and others which the authorities claim to be "north's instructions" were reported after the actions of citizens developed into all-people movements. 
					
					 Mass actions were staged not by the "instructions of the north" but by voluntary participation of citizens and due to all people's anger. 
					
					 There has been no underground revolutionary organization called by the authorities and the case of the attempted rebellion was given a verdict of not guilty, frustrating the authorities' attempt. 
					
					 The editorial urged the "government" to reflect on its reckless attempt to disband the Unified Progressive Party and examine the issue of retracting the motion calling for judgment aimed at dissolving the party.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Make Apology for Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Make Apology for Sexual Slavery
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea held the 1143rd Wednesday meeting outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul on Sept. 10 for settling the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. 
					 The organization said Japan has not made an apology for the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. 
					
					 Japan is still keen on distorting of history and reviving militarism, it noted, adding:
					
					 The south Korean "government" has not taken any measure. 
					
					 Japan should make an apology and reparation for the past crimes as early as possible. 
					
					 The organization declared the will to fight for the settlement of the issue of sexual slavery.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed in Ethiopia
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed in Ethiopia
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Round-table talks took place at Ethiopian institutions and enterprises from Sept. 1 to 4 in the run-up to the 66th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 Present there were personages of the relevant units and masses.
					
					 Personages of a general metal and machine company praised President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un as the greatest men, adding that all the people in the DPRK receive free education and healthcare and are provided with houses by the state free of charge. 
					
					 Those of the Enterprise for Water Project Designing and Control said the Korean people came to lead a happy life as the ones of a full-fledged sovereign state after Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK. He performed great feats in the nation-building and they will shine forever, they added.
					
					 The director of a general hospital said it was thanks to the wise leadership of the great leaders that the DPRK could advance along the road of socialism, firmly adhering to the revolutionary principles. He expressed firm belief that the Korean people would surely build a thriving country, consistently abiding by the socialist principles.
					
					 A vice-director of a hospital and other speakers noted the DPRK which was founded by Kim Il Sung and developed by Kim Jong Il is registering signal achievements in building an economic power under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Mexican Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Mexican Organization on Its Website
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Juche-Oriented Socialist State with Invincible Might" was posted by the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on its website on Sept. 5.
					 The work, published on September 5, Juche 97 (2008), clarifies in detail the idea  that only when the DPRK defends President Kim Il Sung's Juche-based idea of nation-building and his  feats and adds eternal brilliance to them, can it always demonstrate its invincible might.

articles.title: Film Shows Held Abroad to Mark Birthday of DPRK
articles.content:
Film Shows Held Abroad to Mark Birthday of DPRK
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Film shows took place in Mongolia, Thailand, Indonesia, Nigeria and Guinea on Sept. 3 and 4 on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					 Figures of all social standings and masses of relevant countries attended them.
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation" and "Munsu Water Park".
					
					 The vice-president of the National University of Mongolia said he saw the appearance of powerful Songun Korea while watching films, adding he felt truly envious of the Korean people invariably holding aloft the banner of socialism and building a prosperous country, rallied close around Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The manager of the world cereals company of Thailand said the film show helped him know better about the DPRK which has turned into a people's paradise good to live in under the energetic guidance of leader Kim Jong Il. Modern cultural and welfare establishments sprang up and a heyday of construction is being ushered in the DPRK under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, he added.
					
					 A department director of an Indonesian company said the Koreans could fly their national flag with dignity since President Kim Il Sung liberated the country and founded the DPRK.
					
					 A teacher of a university in Guinea said the DPRK founded by the President is ushering in a great heyday of its development.
					
					 The DPRK advancing to emerge an economic, scientific and technological and sports power while consolidating its position as a political, ideological and military power will certainly attain its grandiose goal, he stressed.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Praise DPRK as Socialist Power
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Praise DPRK as Socialist Power
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried articles on September 2 and 5 in the run-up to the 66th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 Nepal Today said in an article titled "Invincible socialist power":
					
					 A few events that drew the world attention at the end of the last century are enough to convince people of the invincibility of the DPRK.
					
					 When the Soviet Union and East European socialist countries collapsed one after another, socialist Korea remained undeterred.
					
					 The DPRK upheld the banner of socialism in the worst adversity in which the imperialists intensified their anti-socialist offensive.
					
					 Furthermore, it greeted a new era of building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 A Bangladeshi paper said in an article captioned "Independent power" the DPRK is known as an independent power in the international community.
					
					 The Indonesia paper International Media reported:
					
					 The dignity of the DPRK as an invincible socialist power is being fully displayed by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Under his leadership the DPRK's defence capability for self-defence is growing stronger and its service personnel and people are making a new history of victories in the confrontation with the U.S.
					
					 Eye-catching progress is being made in the DPRK in building a highly civilized socialist country.
					
					 The DPRK will shine forever as an invincible socialist power.
					
					 The Egyptian paper Al-Misaiya and the Ugandan paper Sun Rise introduced the feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in the nation-building.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones del presidente de Mongolia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones del presidente de Mongolia

articles.title: ACNC urge la retirada de tropas yanquis del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ACNC urge la retirada de tropas yanquis del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 12 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Ahora se alzan las voces en demanda de la retirada de las tropas norteamericanas ocupantes del Sur de Corea.
					La ilegal ocupacion del Sur de Corea perturba la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana y el resto del Nordeste Asiatico. 
					
					Despues de terminada la segunda guerra mundial, las tropas norteamericanas ocuparon el suelo surcoreano pretextando el "desarme del ejercito japones". Durante cerca de 70 anos desde entonces, cumplen en el terreno la estrategia de enfrentamiento y guerra de EE.UU. en el Nordeste Asiatico, incluso la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Ellas no son las fuerzas armadas bajo el mando de la ONU tampoco son tropas de mantenimiento de paz enviadas a las zonas en conflicto en virtud de la resolucion de la ONU. 
					
					El objetivo de su existencia y el contenido de sus operaciones son para agredir a la RPDC y tomar la hegemonia militar en el Nordeste Asiatico. 
					
					Lo mas problematico es los ejercicios belicos conjuntos que realizan esas fuerzas con el Sur de Corea causando el circulo vicioso de agravacion de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Esas maniobras aventureras pueden causar consecuencias catastroficas en la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Despues de firmado el acuerdo de armisticio hasta la fecha, en el suelo surcoreano y su contorno se han desarrollado en mas de 18 mil ocasiones los ejercicios belicos conjuntos contra la RPDC, ademas de los que tuvieron lugar en secreto. 
					
					En los ultimos anos, EE.UU. traslado su enfoque estrategico desde Europa hacia la region de Asia-Pacifico y lanza la flecha de su ofensiva a la RPDC intensificando junto con los belicistas surcoreanos los ejercicios de guerra anti-RPDC de gran envergadura. 
					
					Libra abiertamente hasta los ejercicios de "conquista de Pyongyang" aplicando la "estrategia del disuasivo de forma de ajuste" cuya meta es asestar el ataque preventivo nuclear a la RPDC movilizando los cazabombarderos estrategicos, portaaviones y submarinos nucleares. 
					
					Las tropas norteamericanas ocupantes del Sur de Corea son consideradas como causa raiz de la inestabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y el resto del Nordeste Asiatico. 
					
					Ahora la opinion publica mundial demanda la retirada de ellas que son inutiles a la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y la region. 
					
					Un informe recien publicado por el SSI (Instituto de Asuntos Estrategicos) de EE.UU. planteo la necesidad de revisar el problema de mantener la presencia de tropas norteamericanas en el extranjero, en particular, en el Sur de Corea. 
					
					Presentaron las mismas opiniones el CSIS, el AEI y el RAND llamados como cerebros estrategicos de EE.UU. 
					
					El Sur de Corea y la sociedad internacional y hasta en el interior de EE.UU. demandan la retirada de tropas norteamericanas estacionadas en suelo surcoreano. 
					
					Es anacronico el mantenimiento de esas fuerzas en la actualidad en que se cambiaron las relaciones internacionales del Nordeste Asiatico debido al fin de la guerra fria. 
					
					EE.UU. debe retirar cuanto antes a sus tropas ocupantes del Sur de Corea, causa raigal de la division de la Peninsula Coreana y ente canceroso para la paz.
